snippet: The Mets have baseball’s second-worst batting average, better only than the Marlins. If they continue at this mark, they could tie the batting average of the 1968 Mets, who won 73 games.
abstract: New York Mets’ futility at the plate has been glaring this season, and as their problems have worsened, the situation has begun to invoke memorable low points from the club’s past.
lead_paragraph: The Mets have baseball’s second-worst batting average, better only than the Marlins. If they continue at this mark, they could tie the batting average of the 1968 Mets, who won 73 games.

headline.seo: Mets, at .228, Are Hitting Rock Bottom
headline.main: With Batting Average of .228, the Mets Are in Danger of Hitting a Low Point
headline.print_headline: With Team Batting Average of .228, the Mets Are in Danger of Hitting a Low Point
